results.content:
I'm enjoying the course and the delivery. I just missed knowing a little about the instructor. The beginning was a little harsh like "ok, guys, so this is node". I think an introductory video like "so, I'm Kati Frantz, this course is so and so" would be nice :)
- update: Some things like url parser outdated, express edge returning { config, engine } instead of a default module, and some questions unanswered were some things that could be updated so students are not at a loss in this course. I'm loving the things I'm learning, they're valuable, but it seems like the course has been abandoned

results.content:
The instructor teaches pretty well, and is easy to follow, but there are many flaws.  

Node and mongodb are used, but the course doesn't provide much detail about them.  More than anything the course is useful for showing you how to work with templating and it introduces you to many various packages you might need in a sample app.  Those are interesting topics, but not what I expected from a class focusing on Node and mongodb.

Occasionally the directions the instructor gives don't work, and when that happens the Q&A is inconsitent with its help. Mostly it's other students who provide assistance and helpful answers, not the instructor or TA.  In the last few sections of the course there are requests for help left by students going back 6 months or even 2 years that never got a response.  Very disappointing.   It feels like the instructor created this course and then stopped paying attention to it. 

One very basic thing this course ignores is what version of node to use.  Some of the code didn't work because I needed a more recent version of node.  The instructor should have paid attention to such a basic detail that will trip up students.

It's a small thing, but why does the instructor end every recording with "I'll catch you up in the next lesson."?  Does he mean "catch up with you?"  or "Catch you?"  Why say the same thing dozens of times?  Why does he say he'll "catch you up in the next lesson" at the end of the course when there are no more lessons?

I would have rated this course higher if the Q&A had more support and if the teaching was more focused on node and mongodb.
results.content_html:
The instructor teaches pretty well, and is easy to follow, but there are many flaws.

Node and mongodb are used, but the course doesn't provide much detail about them. More than anything the course is useful for showing you how to work with templating and it introduces you to many various packages you might need in a sample app. Those are interesting topics, but not what I expected from a class focusing on Node and mongodb.

Occasionally the directions the instructor gives don't work, and when that happens the Q&A is inconsitent with its help. Mostly it's other students who provide assistance and helpful answers, not the instructor or TA. In the last few sections of the course there are requests for help left by students going back 6 months or even 2 years that never got a response. Very disappointing. It feels like the instructor created this course and then stopped paying attention to it.

One very basic thing this course ignores is what version of node to use. Some of the code didn't work because I needed a more recent version of node. The instructor should have paid attention to such a basic detail that will trip up students.

It's a small thing, but why does the instructor end every recording with "I'll catch you up in the next lesson."? Does he mean "catch up with you?" or "Catch you?" Why say the same thing dozens of times? Why does he say he'll "catch you up in the next lesson" at the end of the course when there are no more lessons?

I would have rated this course higher if the Q&A had more support and if the teaching was more focused on node and mongodb.

results.content:
This was a great course. I struggled to really understand NodeJS prior to this course. At this point I feel very comfortable creating Node apps. I feel like I can create a ton of different node apps. There was only a couple things I wish was added to the course: 

1. Adding the app to github
2. Pagination
3. Blog comments

Other than that, it was a great course with great information that was explained very well. I had to slow the play speed to 0.75, but once I did that, it was a great experience. I have a solid foundation, and plan to continue my journey.
results.content_html:
This was a great course. I struggled to really understand NodeJS prior to this course. At this point I feel very comfortable creating Node apps. I feel like I can create a ton of different node apps. There was only a couple things I wish was added to the course:

2. Pagination
3. Blog comments

Other than that, it was a great course with great information that was explained very well. I had to slow the play speed to 0.75, but once I did that, it was a great experience. I have a solid foundation, and plan to continue my journey.

results.content:
Course was good to run through some basics. Would be nice to know if these are popular ways of creating apps or if just the tutors personal way of doing things.

Especially when it comes to choosing specific packages to download or which other databases are available and also are there alternatives to cloudinary?

Other than that, he works very very very fast and often I had to pause because I couldnt keep up which meant that sometimes I was just copy typing rather than actually learning but I do feel a lot more knowledgeable now that I've finished but still not able to embark on an app of my own just yet. Thanks again for a very comprehensive course!

results.content: Yes, definitely a perfect match as i am new to all that's being taught.  I have finished about 15 lessons and already leaned so much: creating an express server, using nodemon to automatically restart the server, defining routes and serving files, using a templating engine....all these expertly taught by Mr. Frantz in a very confident, clear, excellently spoken English with crystal clear audio, easily readable font, and a pleasant-for-the-eye color theme.  I am feeling really excited and looking forward to complete the create blog project.  I honestly feel this is a not-to-be-missed course for any aspiring  node/express JS developer.
results.content_html: Yes, definitely a perfect match as i am new to all that's being taught. I have finished about 15 lessons and already leaned so much: creating an express server, using nodemon to automatically restart the server, defining routes and serving files, using a templating engine....all these expertly taught by Mr. Frantz in a very confident, clear, excellently spoken English with crystal clear audio, easily readable font, and a pleasant-for-the-eye color theme. I am feeling really excited and looking forward to complete the create blog project. I honestly feel this is a not-to-be-missed course for any aspiring node/express JS developer.

results.content: This is exactly what I was looking for.  I took two other Node bootcamp courses that went very in-depth.  They were great, but pretty advanced, so when it came time to build my own first project (just a simple blog website with articles and a few other features) I felt lost and overwhelmed about what I actually needed.  I am so happy I found this course because it gave me a good review of the absolute basics necessary to get a simple website up and running using Node, Express, and MongoDB.
results.content_html: This is exactly what I was looking for. I took two other Node bootcamp courses that went very in-depth. They were great, but pretty advanced, so when it came time to build my own first project (just a simple blog website with articles and a few other features) I felt lost and overwhelmed about what I actually needed. I am so happy I found this course because it gave me a good review of the absolute basics necessary to get a simple website up and running using Node, Express, and MongoDB.

results.content:
Was  good overview of node and some of the node libraries that are available to use for some features. The instructor does gloss over the detail of how some things work, but adding that in would make the course much longer. 


Learnt a bit of the way to structure a node app and feel comfortable with it now.

results.content: Highly recommended course. Nice explanation with examples. Kati has great expertise in this subject and I would certainly love to hear more from him soon.

results.content: Hi, This course is a complete game changer for me. Thank You for this amazing course. Keep Working.

results.content:
I understood very well the logic and implementation of all libraries, also the logic of MVC and how nodeJs and mongoDb works.

I saw this course to learn how nodeJs and mongoDB communicate together, but I don't want to use edge..I want to use angular 6 and for this I am a little disappointed, but this has nothing to do with the course. The course was great and was about NodeJs and mongoDB and I give Kati Frantz a 5star rating for this course.

Thank You

response.content: Thanks a lot for your feedback Kane. I am very grateful.

results.content: Although the course covers a lot of material and was well-explained, it was a bit fast paced for a novice to follow. Also, it wasn't always possible to type in the same code as the instructor and get the application to work.
results.content_html: Although the course covers a lot of material and was well-explained, it was a bit fast paced for a novice to follow. Also, it wasn't always possible to type in the same code as the instructor and get the application to work.

results.content: I thought this was a really good course. Liked the teaching style, it worked for me. A good primer for working with Node JS and MongoDB and it provides a level of understanding that provides a good foundation for further learning. This is the first course I have done with this author, and I was not disappointed as I learned a lot - things are simplified, and that's what a lot of people need when they are just starting out. Understanding the concept of what's happening and when - and the author nailed that for me. My only regret... that there was a not a video on pagination, as I would have liked to see how this would be implemented - hopefully the author will add this to the course at some point? Thanks for a great course!
results.content_html: I thought this was a really good course. Liked the teaching style, it worked for me. A good primer for working with Node JS and MongoDB and it provides a level of understanding that provides a good foundation for further learning. This is the first course I have done with this author, and I was not disappointed as I learned a lot - things are simplified, and that's what a lot of people need when they are just starting out. Understanding the concept of what's happening and when - and the author nailed that for me. My only regret... that there was a not a video on pagination, as I would have liked to see how this would be implemented - hopefully the author will add this to the course at some point? Thanks for a great course!
